title: How not to spin the worst jobs numbers in four years
text:
You can always tell when the economic numbers are good: the big beasts in Government hoover up all the glory, racing to get their faces all over the news.

Last month’s jobs figures were great, as pay growth hit its highest level in more than a decade.

Sure enough, up popped Sajid Javid, the Chancellor, to bask in the limelight.

This month is a different story. The biggest quarterly fall in employment for four years. Unemployment up. Pay growth slipping.

So spare a thought for Mims Davies - the employment minister in the Department for Work and Pensions, for anyone unfamiliar with the name - who was sent to man the barricades.
